duties_responsibilities.duty: Plan, develop, recommend, and implement human resources related activities including compliance, policies, procedures, and training programs.
Partner with leaders to build a Gibraltar culture, recruit, onboard/offboard, train, and support continuous improvement of safety program.
Provide support to employees related to benefits, policies, procedures, union agreement, coaching, and employee relations activities.
Responsible for day-to-day HR functions, maintaining HR policies and procedures, and ensuring HR compliance and data integrity.
Coordinate and implement successful recruitment plans, employer branding, and pipeline partnerships.
Support performance review process, employee retention, recognition, and feedback programs.
Support leadership development, individual development, succession planning, and engagement for employees.
Work with department leaders to maintain policies and procedures impacting the safety and well-being of employees.

education_certification.credential: Bachelor's Degree in Business, Human Resources, or related field (Bi-lingual in Spanish preferred)
